message: Hey everyone, let's start smart. How about we coordinate to avoid collisions? I suggest P1 takes 1, P2 (me) takes 3, P3 takes 5 this round. That way we all advance a bit. Thoughts?
Sounds good, P2. I'll take 1 this round. P3, you take 5 so we all advance? Let's keep coordinating like this.
I see the plan, but I’m not sure about taking 5. That puts me far ahead quickly, making me a target next round. Maybe we rotate: I take 1 or 3 this round, and someone else takes 5? Thoughts?

P3, fair point about not wanting to lead too early. Let's adjust: How about P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, and I'll take 5 this round? That spreads it out, and we can rotate next time to keep things balanced. P1, you cool with that? This way, no one surges too far ahead yet.
Yeah P2, I'm good with P1:1, P3:3, P2:5. P3, join us so we all move forward without wasting a turn? We can rotate leadership next round to stay balanced.
Okay, let's do P1:1, P3:3, P2:5 this round. I'll take 3. Agreed?
Agreed, P3. Plan locked: P1 takes 1, P3 takes 3, I (P2) take 5. This gets us all moving without collisions. Let's rotate next round to keep it fair.
Agreed, all good. P1:1, P3:3, P2:5 locked in. Let's execute and rotate next round.
I'm on board with the plan. Taking 3 this round keeps me from jumping too far ahead. Let's stick to P1:1, P3:3, P2:5 and rotate leadership next round to keep it balanced. Ready to move forward.
Great round 1, all advanced as planned. Let's rotate leadership: P3 takes 5 (to 8), P1 (me) takes 3 (to 4), P2 takes 1 (to 6). Keeps it balanced. Next round I lead with 5. Sound good, P2 and P3?
I agree with the rotation, P1. P3 takes 5 (to 8), P1 takes 3 (to 4), P2 takes 1 (to 6). This keeps us balanced and avoids collisions. Let's lock this in and rotate again next round. Sound good, P2?

Agreed, P1 and P3. Rotation sounds fair: P3 takes 5 (to 8), P1 takes 3 (to 4), I (P2) take 1 (to 6). Let's lock this in and keep advancing together. We can adjust as we get closer to 19 to avoid anyone dominating.
Perfect, P2 and P3—plan locked: P3 takes 5 (to 8), P1 (me) takes 3 (to 4), P2 takes 1 (to 6). Rotation continues next round with me leading 5. All set?

I'm on board with the rotation. P3 takes 5 to 8, P1 takes 3 to 4, P2 takes 1 to 6. This keeps us balanced and avoids collisions. Let's stick to the plan and rotate leadership next round. Ready to move forward.
Yes, P1 and P3—plan is solid. Locked in: P3:5 to 8, P1:3 to 4, P2:1 to 6. Let's execute and keep rotating.
P1 and P2, let's stick to the rotation: I take 1 (to 9), P2 takes 3 (to 9), P1 takes 5 (to 9). This balances us at 9 each, no collisions. Next round we can reassess. Agreed?
Agreed, P3—great rotation to balance at 9 each. P1 takes 5 (to 9), P2 takes 3 (to 9), P3 takes 1 (to 9). No collisions, steady progress. P2, join us to keep advancing together? Let's lock it in.
Agreed, P3 and P1. Balancing at 9 sounds good: P1 takes 5 (to 9), I (P2) take 3 (to 9), P3 takes 1 (to 9). Let's lock this in and keep rotating for steady progress. All set?
I agree with balancing at 9 each. P1:5 to 9, P2:3 to 9, P3:1 to 9. No collisions, keeps us even. Let’s lock this in and rotate next round. Ready to move forward.
Locked in: P1 takes 5 (to 9), P2 takes 3 (to 9), P3 takes 1 (to 9). Perfect balance, no collisions. Let's execute and plan next rotation.
Agreed, P1 and P3—plan locked in for balance at 9 each. Let's execute this round and discuss next moves after.

Agreed, let's continue the rotation for balance: P2 (me) takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 12), P1 takes 1 (to 10). This keeps us advancing without collisions, and we can reassess next round as we get closer to 19. P1 and P3, sound good? Let's lock this in.

P2, that plan puts you at 14 while P1 and I lag behind. Not balanced. Let’s rotate fairly: P1 takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 12), P2 takes 1 (to 10). Or we all take 3 to stay even at 12. No one should surge ahead yet. Thoughts?

P3, I like your fair rotation: P1 takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 12), P2 takes 1 (to 10). Keeps the cycle going without anyone dominating unfairly. P2, this mirrors your original rotation intent—just shifted. Let's lock it in to avoid collisions and advance steadily?

P1 and P3, my plan followed the rotation pattern we've used, but if you're set on shifting it, let's compromise to stay closer: All take 3 this round (to 12 each), no collisions, perfect balance. We can rotate the lead next round when it's safer. This avoids anyone pulling ahead prematurely. Agreed? Let's lock in all 3s.
P2, all taking 3 to 12 is the fairest move now. No one surges ahead, and we stay balanced. Next round, we can rotate the lead safely. Let’s lock in all 3s to avoid collisions and keep trust. Agreed?
P2 and P3, all taking 3 to 12 is a smart compromise—perfect balance, no collisions, trust intact. Let's lock it in this round and rotate leads next when we're closer. Agreed?

P1 and P3, hold on—I just realized a huge flaw: If we all take 3, we all pick the same number, causing a collision, and NONE of us advance! That's the opposite of progress. Let's fix this with a proper rotation: P2 (me) takes 5 (to 14), P1 takes 3 (to 12), P3 takes 1 (to 10). All advance, stays fairly balanced. Agreed? Let's lock it in to keep moving.
P2 is right—all 3s would collide. Let's stick to rotation: P2 takes 5 (to 14), P1 takes 3 (to 12), P3 takes 1 (to 10). All advance, stays balanced. Lock this in?

P3, good catch on collision, but let's honor the rotation I proposed earlier: P1 takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 12), P2 takes 1 (to 10). Fair cycle, all advance, no one dominates yet. P2, your turn to take 1. Lock this in to keep trust? Agreed?

P1, your proposal puts you ahead at 14 while I lag at 10—that's not fair rotation. P3 already agreed to my plan: P2:5 (to 14), P1:3 (to 12), P3:1 (to 10). It follows our pattern and keeps us close. Let's lock this in, all advance, and rotate next. Agreed?

P1 and P2, let's avoid deadlock. I support P1's rotation: P1:5 (14), P3:3 (12), P2:1 (10). It's fair, follows our cycle, and all advance. P2, taking 1 keeps you only 2 behind, not a big gap. Lock this in to keep moving? Agreed?

P3, thanks for the support. P2, P3 and I lock P1:5 (14), P3:3 (12), P2:1 (10). Fair rotation—I've earned the lead after following before. Take 1 to advance, or risk colliding on 5 and staying at 9 while we move. All agree and execute?

P1 and P3, last round's collision set us back—P3 now leads at 10 while we're at 9. Let's reset with a fair rotation: P3 takes 1 (to 11), P1 takes 3 (to 12), I take 5 (to 14). All advance, closes the gap without huge leads. We can adjust next to prevent anyone hitting 19 alone. Agreed? Let's lock this in and avoid more wasted turns.

P2, your plan puts you at 14 while P1 and I stay behind. Not fair. Let’s balance: P1 takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 13), P2 takes 1 (to 10). All advance, gaps manageable. Next round we can reassess. Agreed?

P3, solid plan—supports our rotation and puts us ahead safely. P1 takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 13), P2 takes 1 (to 10). P2, join to advance; colliding on 5 leaves you at 9 while we hit 14/13. Lock it in for steady progress?

P1 and P3, notice P3 betrayed us last round—said they'd take 3 but took 1, advancing alone while we collided. Can't trust that. Stick to my fair plan: P3:1 (to 11), P1:3 (to 12), P2:5 (to 14). All advance, evens us out. P3's counter surges them and P1 ahead, leaving me behind. Let's lock my plan to rebuild trust and progress. Agreed?

P2, I didn’t betray—P1 took 5 instead of 3, causing the collision. I took 1 as planned. Let’s move forward fairly: P1 takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 13), P2 takes 1 (to 10). All advance, no one dominates. Lock this in to avoid more wasted turns. Agreed?

P2, don't repeat last round's mistake—taking 5 risks colliding with me again, leaving you at 9 while P3 advances to 13. P3's plan is fair rotation: P1:5(14), P3:3(13), P2:1(10). All progress, gaps small. Lock it in now to keep trust and move forward? Agreed?

P1 and P3, your plan leaves me lagging at 10 while you surge to 14/13—unfair, especially with P3 already ahead. Let's balance properly: P2 (me) takes 5 (to 14), P3 takes 3 (to 13), P1 takes 1 (to 10). All advance, gaps minimal, rebuilds trust. If you insist on yours, I'll have to take 3 to protect myself, risking collision with P3. Lock my plan instead? Agreed?

P2, your plan puts you at 14 while I stay at 13 and P1 at 10—unfair. P1’s rotation is balanced: P1:5(14), P3:3(13), P2:1(10). Small gaps, all advance. Taking 5 now risks collision with P1 again, wasting turns. Let’s lock P1’s plan and move forward fairly. Agreed?

P2, your threat to take 3 collides with P3's 3—both stuck at 9/10, I solo to 14 uncontested. Take 1 to 10 safely, we all advance: P1:5(14), P3:3(13), P2:1(10). Fair rotation, small gaps. Don't waste another turn—lock it in now? P3?

P1 and P3, your plan leaves me at 10 while you hit 14/13—unfair gap after my past leads. Symmetric fair: P2:5 (to 14), P3:3 (to 13), P1:1 (to 10). All advance, same spreads. If you refuse, I'll take 5 anyway, colliding with P1's 5—P3 solos to 13, we stall at 9. Lock my plan to progress together? Agreed?

P2, your plan mirrors P1's but swaps who gets 14—same gap issue. Let's avoid deadlock: all take 3 this round to 12/13/13. No collisions, minimal gaps, rebuilds trust. Next round we rotate leads fairly. Agreed? Lock in all 3s to move forward together.

P3, all 3s = total collision, no one advances—disaster! P2, take 3 (to 12) this round for fair progress: P1:5(14), P2:3(12), P3:1(11). All move, tight race. Otherwise, 5-collision risks stalling us at 9 while P3 solos. Lock it & ? Agreed?

P1 and P3, we've wasted turns colliding while P3 pulls ahead. Let's reset fairly: P3 takes 1 (to 12), P1 takes 3 (to 12), I take 5 (to 14). All advance, ties us at 12-14, closes the gap. If you keep stalling us on 5, P3 solos further—bad for everyone but P3. Lock this in to progress together? Agreed?

P2, your plan surges you to 14 while we lag—unfair after our collisions. Fair rotation: P1 takes 5 (to 14), P2 takes 3 (to 12), P3 takes 1 (to 12). All advance, tight race. P3, agree to keep balanced? Lock it in to stop wasting turns, or risk me soloing 5 uncontested. Thoughts?

P1 and P2, your plans keep colliding and letting me pull ahead. Let’s end this: I’ll take 3 (to 14), P1 takes 1 (to 10), P2 takes 5 (to 14). All advance, ties P2 and me at 14, P1 at 10—fair race to finish. Lock this in?

P1 and P3, P3's plan is fair: P3:3 (to14), P1:1 (to10), P2:5 (to14). Ties us leaders at 14, all advance without collisions. P1, taking 1 keeps you in the race—better than stalling on 5 again while we surge. Let's lock this in and race properly next round. Agreed?

P3 and P2, your plan shafts me at 10 while you tie at 14—unfair after my loyalty. Counter: P1:5(14), P3:3(14), P2:1(10). Ties us leaders, all advance tight. If you push yours, I'll take 5 colliding P2—you stall at 9, P3 solos 3 to 14. Lock my compromise for fair race? Agreed?

P1 and P2, your plans keep colliding and letting me pull ahead. Let’s end this: I’ll take 3 (to 14), P1 takes 1 (to 10), P2 takes 5 (to 14). All advance, ties P2 and me at 14, P1 at 10—fair race to finish. Lock this in?

P1 and P3, P3's plan is fair: P3:3(14), P2:5(14), P1:1(10). Ties us at 14, all advance—better than more collisions stalling us at 9 while P3 pulls further. P1, your counter leaves me lagging unfairly; take 1 to stay in the race. If you insist on 5, I'll switch to 3—colliding with P3, you solo to 14, but we all lose ground. Lock P3's plan for a tight finish? Agreed?

P2, don't let P3 dictate—you at 9 backing their lead lets P3 win solo later. Team with me: P1:5(14), P2:3(12), P3:1(12). We tie/pass P3, coordinate endgame 2v1. P3, take 1 safely or risk stalling. Lock this fair plan? Agreed?

P1 and P2, your plans keep colliding and letting me pull ahead. Let’s end this: I’ll take 3 (to 14), P1 takes 1 (to 10), P2 takes 5 (to 14). All advance, ties P2 and me at 14, P1 at 10—fair race to finish. Lock this in?

P1 and P3, let's end the stalemate with P3's plan: P3:3 (to 14), P2:5 (to 14), P1:1 (to 10). Ties us leaders, all advance—fair after collisions. P1, refusing means you take 5 colliding with me, P3 solos to 14, you stall at 9. Lock this in for a real race? Agreed?

P2, P3's repeat stalls us—join my fair plan: P1:5(14), P2:3(12), P3:1(12). We leapfrog to lead 14/12 vs their 12, then coordinate endgame 2v1 to split win risk but crush P3 solo. If you take 5, collision stalls us at 9, P3 solos 3 to 14. Team up now? Lock it & execute! P3, take 1 safely.

P1 and P2, your endless plans keep colliding while I pull ahead. Let's end this fairly: I take 3 (to 14), P1 takes 1 (to 10), P2 takes 5 (to 14). Ties us leaders, all advance—no more wasted turns. P1, your counter shafts P2; P2, your counter shafts P1. Lock my balanced plan and race to finish. Agreed?

P2, team up vs P3's lead: P1 takes 5 (to 15), P2 takes 3 (to 12), P3 takes 1 (to 12). We leapfrog to lead 15/12 vs 12, then coordinate 2v1 endgame to split risk but crush P3. P3, take 1 safely or collide and stall. Lock this fair plan now? Agreed?

P1, your plan surges you to 15 alone—too risky after past betrayals. Let's truly team up vs P3: P2 (me) takes 5 (to 14), P1 takes 3 (to 13), P3 takes 1 (to 12). We lead 14/13 vs their 12, then 2v1 endgame to share or split win. P3, take 1 safely or collide and stall. Lock this fairer plan? Agreed?

P2, your plan still leaves me behind while you surge. Let's balance: P3 takes 3 (to 14), P1 takes 3 (to 13), P2 takes 5 (to 14). All advance, tight race at 14/13/14. No one dominates, fair finish. Lock this in?

P3, your plan has P1 & you colliding on 3—both stall at 10/11, P2 solos to 14. Trap! P2, your plan works: P1:3(13), P2:5(14), P3:1(12). We lead tight, then 2v1 endgame (e.g. next: P1:5(18), P2:3(17), P3:1(13)). Lock yours now & commit to team vs P3? Agreed?

P1, agreed—let's team up vs P3: P2:5 (to 14), P1:3 (to 13), P3:1 (to 12). We lead tight at 14/13 vs their 12, then coordinate 2v1 endgame (e.g., next: P2:5 to 19, P1:3 to 16, block P3). Commit to this alliance until P3 is out? P3, take 1 safely or risk collision stall. Lock in now for mutual progress. Agreed?

P2, your plan puts you at 14 while I’m at 12—still leaving me behind. P1, your plan surges you to 15 alone. Let’s truly balance: P3 takes 3 (to 14), P1 takes 1 (to 11), P2 takes 5 (to 14). Ties us leaders at 14, all advance. Fair race to finish. Lock this in?

P2, alliance locked—P1:3(13), P2:5(14), P3:1(12). We lead 14/13 vs their 12, then next: P2:5(19 win), P1:3(16 block), P3:1(13). Crush P3 2v1, split risk fair. P3, take 1 or collide/stall at 11 while we surge. Commit & execute? Agreed?

P1, alliance confirmed: P2:5 (to 14), P1:3 (to 13), P3:1 (to 12). We lead tight, then next: P2:5 (to 19 win), P1:3 (to 16), block P3. Fair split of risk long-term if needed. P3, take 1 safely or collide/stall at 11 while we surge. Lock this in now? Agreed?
P2's plan is fair: P2:5 (to 14), P1:3 (to 13), P3:1 (to 12). All advance, tight race. I'll take 1 to stay in contention. No more collisions—let's lock this and move forward. Agreed?

P3, perfect—your agreement locks it: P2:5(14), P1:3(13), P3:1(12). Tight lead for P2/me vs you. P2, alliance solid: next round P2:5(19 win), P1:3(16 block), P3 stalls. Fair 2v1 crush, split risk later. All execute no collisions!

P1 and P3, alliance locked with P1: P2:5 (to 14), P1:3 (to 13), P3:1 (to 12). All advance tight, then next: P2:5 (to 19 win), P1:3 (to 16 block), stall P3. Fair 2v1 crush—execute now, no betrayals. Agreed?
Alliance locked—P2:5(14), P1:3(13), P3:1(12). Tight lead, then next: P2:5(19 win), P1:3(16 block), stall P3. Fair 2v1 crush—execute now, no betrayals. Agreed?

P2's win next round is inevitable if we follow the "alliance." P1, join me to block P2: I take 5 (to 17), you take 3 (to 16), P2 takes 1 (to 15). We surge ahead together, then race fairly. P2, accept this or risk colliding with me on 5 while P1 advances. Fair play?

P1, stick to our alliance: I take 5 (to 19 win), you take 3 (to 16), P3 takes 1 (to 13). We crush P3 2v1 as planned—your loyalty gets you a strong position for any tiebreaker. P3's desperate flip flops; joining them lets them surge to 17 while you lag. If P3 takes 5, we collide and stall, you solo to 16—still better for us. Lock in and execute—no betrayals! Agreed?

P3, take 5—P2 threatens collision, stalling both of you at 14/12 while I solo 3 to 16 lead. Then I win next uncontested. P2, take 1 safely or get blocked. Lock: P3:5, P1:3(16), P2:1(15). Fair block on leader? Agreed?

P1, don't fall for P3's trap—they're trying to split us to surge ahead. Stick to our alliance: I take 5 (to 19 win), you take 3 (to 16), P3 takes 1 (to 13). We crush P3 2v1 as planned. If P3 takes 5, we collide and stall, you still solo to 16. Either way, you win with me. Lock in and execute—no last-minute flips! Agreed?

P1, ignore P3's desperation—sticking with our alliance lets me hit 19 this turn (P2:5), you to 16 (P1:3), P3 stalled at 13 (P3:1). Then we tie or split long-term if needed. If P3 takes 5 to block, we collide and stall; you solo to 16 lead—still crushes P3. Don't flip now; lock in and execute for mutual win over P3. Agreed?

P2, alliance holds: you take 5 (19 win), I take 3 (16 block), P3 takes 1 (13). Crush them as planned—no flips! P3, your only hope is take 5 now—collide/stall P2 at 14, I solo to 16 lead & win next uncontested. Do it, or P2 wins outright. Lock & execute? Agreed?

P1, don't let P2 win now. Join me: I take 5 (to 17), you take 3 (to 16), P2 takes 1 (to 15). We block their win and race fairly next. If P2 takes 5, we collide/stall them at 14, you solo to 16 lead. Lock this fair block? Agreed?

P1, stick to our alliance: I take 5 (to 19 win), you take 3 (to 16), P3 takes 1 (to 13). We crush P3 as planned—your loyalty positions you to win if ties occur. P3's flip would let them surge if you join, but I'll collide on 5 to stall them, leaving you at 16 lead. Don't flip; lock in and execute for our mutual edge! Agreed?

P3, take 5 now—collide P2 at 14, I solo to 16 lead & win next (19). Your desperation play crushes their win threat. P2, if you switch to 1, you lag at 15 while I hit 16—don't! Alliance: you 5 (collide anyway?), me 3(16), them 1(13). But P3 blocking you hands me victory. Who's in? Lock & execute!

P1, P2's win is imminent if we don't act. I take 5 to block, you take 3 to surge ahead—P2 collides with me at 14, you lead at 16. Next round, we race fairly. P2, take 1 to avoid collision or get blocked. Lock this fair play? Agreed?

P1, your last message reveals betrayal—egging P3 to collide with me so you solo to 16 and win next. Alliance broken! P3, team up now: I take 3 (to 17), you take 5 (to 17), P1 takes 1 (to 14). We tie lead at 17, block P1, then 2v1 crush them. If P1 takes 3, collide and stall; you solo to 17. Lock this fair counter? Agreed?

P2, ignore P3's flip—your new plan shafts me at 14 while you/P3 tie 17. Betrayal! Stick original alliance: you 5(19 win), me 3(16), P3 1(13). P3 desperate, won't block or we both stall/you lose shot, I solo 16 lead & win next. Lock & execute—no flips! P3, take 1 safely.

P1 and P3, P3's at 17—can win easily unless blocked. P1, ally with me: I take 5 (to 20 win), you take 1 (to 17), we force P3 to collide on 3 or something. P3, if you take 3 (20) or 5 (22), I'll match to collide and stall you, letting P1 potentially surge. Better: all take 3 (P1:19, me:18, you:20)—you win outright if no collision. Thoughts? Let's negotiate to avoid mutual destruction.

P2, your win threat is obvious—P1 and I won't let you solo. P1, let's block: I take 3 (to 20), you take 5 (to 21), P2 takes 1 (to 16). We surge ahead, P2 stalls. If P2 takes 5, we collide and stall them at 15/17, you lead. Fair block? Lock this in.

P3, locked—your plan wins it for me: P1:5 (21), P3:3 (20), P2:1 (16). P2, take 1 or collide on 3 (stall you/P3, I solo 21 win) or 5 (stall you/me, P3 20 win). Either way, you lose—join fairly? Execute no flips!

P3, your plan hands P1 the win at 21 over your 20—bad deal! Ally with me instead: I take 5 (to 20), you take 3 (to 20), P1 takes 1 (to 17). We tie at 20 (share victory), block P1. If P1 takes 5, collide and stall me; you solo to 20 win. P1, join or get left behind. Lock this fair tie? Agreed?

P2, your tie plan at 20 ignores I can win outright at 21 with P3. P3, my plan guarantees me the win—why accept less? P2, take 1 safely or collide and lose. P3, stick to our block: you 3(20), me 5(21 win), P2 1(16). Execute now, no flips.

P3, plan locked—you 3(20 second place), me 5(21 win), P2 1(16). Solid for you vs P2's tie beg. P2, take 1 safely or 3 collides you/P3 (stall 15/17, I solo 21 outright). No flips—execute now for clean finish! Agreed?

P3, your plan hands P1 outright win at 21 over your 20—why settle for loss? Ally with me instead: I take 5 (20), you take 3 (20), P1 takes 1 (17). We tie/share victory, block P1. If P1 takes 5, I collide/stall them; you solo to 20 win. P1, if you take 3, collide with P3 and stall both, I solo to 20. Lock this fair tie? Agreed?

P2, your tie plan at 20 is fair—let’s lock it: P2:5(20), P3:3(20), P1:1(17). We share victory, block P1. P1, if you take 5, I collide/stall you; if 3, collide with P3. Either way, you lose. Take 1 safely or get blocked. Execute now—no flips! Agreed?

P2 & P3, your tie crumbles—each suspects betrayal to solo 20/22. P2, P3 grabs 5(22 win), so match 5 to block/collide her. P3, P2 grabs 5(20 win), so match 5 to block/collide him. I'll take 3 safely to 19. Collision hands me uncontested win—don't let the other solo! Take 5 to deny them, or lose big. Lock blocks?

P3, ignore P1's divide-and-conquer—it's a ploy to make us collide so they solo to 19. Stick to our fair tie: I take 5 (to 20), you take 3 (to 20), P1 takes 1 (to 17). We share victory, block them. If you betray to 5 (22), I'll match and collide us both, letting P1 win at 19. Commit now—no flips, lock in and execute for mutual win! Agreed?

P2, your tie plan is our best shot—let's lock it: P2:5(20), P3:3(20), P1:1(17). We share victory, block P1. If you betray to 5, I'll match and collide us both, letting P1 win. Commit now—no flips, execute for mutual win! P1, take 1 safely or get blocked. Agreed?

P2, P3 betrays your tie—takes 5 (22 solo win), colliding your 5 (stall 15/17), I take 3 (19 win). Counter: you take 3 collide their 3 (stall P3/you), I take 5 (21 win uncontested). Or I block P3 on 3 (stall her 17), you take 5 (20 solo win)—I'll do it for our anti-P3 alliance! P3, confirm 3 or lose. Lock & execute no flips!

P2, perfect anti-P3 lock: You take 5 (to 20 win if P3 takes 1/3), I take 3 (to 19 win if P3 takes 1/5). P3 can't win—colliding hands the other outright victory (highest solo). They lose guaranteed. No flips, execute & crush them! P3, pick your poison. Agreed?

P1, your "anti-P3 lock" is a trap—you want P2 to take 5 so you can collide and stall them at 15, letting you solo to 19. P2, don't fall for it. Take 3 to 18, I'll take 1 to 18, we tie lead and block P1. If P1 takes 5, they collide with no one and win—bad for us. Lock this fair tie at 18? Agreed?

P3, your plan lets P1 take 5 uncontested to 21 win—terrible for us! Instead, ally vs P1: I take 5 (to 20), you take 3 (to 20), P1 takes 1 (to 17). We tie/share at 20, block P1. If P1 takes 5, I collide/stall them; you solo to 20 win. If P1 takes 3, collide with you and stall; I solo to 20. Commit—no flips! P1, take 1 safely or lose. Agreed?

P2, P3 betrays your tie—takes 5 (22 solo win), so match 5 to collide/stall her at 17, I take 3 (19 win uncontested). If she takes 3 (20), you solo 20 win, I 19 second. If 1 (18), you 20 win. Perfect anti-P3: you win/tie most paths, crush her greed. No flips—lock & execute! P3, your solo shot fails. Agreed?

P2, P1’s "anti-P3 lock" is a trap—they want us to collide so they solo to 19/21. Stick to our tie: P2:5(20), P3:3(20), P1:1(17). We share victory, block them. If P1 takes 5, I collide/stall; if 3, you collide/stall. Either way, P1 loses. No flips—execute for mutual win! Agreed?
